excerpt: Ruined, 16th-century, red sandstone castle on a hillside, with guided tours & a huge wine barrel.
detail_description: Heidelberg Castle, a 16th-century red sandstone fortress, stands proudly on a hillside overlooking the Altstadt and the Neckar River. Visitors can enjoy guided tours of the castle's interior and marvel at its Renaissance architecture. The castle is accessible via a steep cobbled trail or by taking the Bergbahn cogwheel train from Kornmarkt station.
name: Heidelberg Castle

excerpt: Weaving up the hillside, this famed pathway features gardens, statues & views of the castle & river.
detail_description: Philosophenweg, also known as the Philosophers Way, is a renowned 2 km walking path located along the Neckar River. The pathway offers stunning views of the castle, river, and cityscape. It is partially wooded and features beautiful sunny gardens along its route. The name "Philosophers Path" originates from the university scholars who sought solitude for contemplation and inspiration while strolling along this picturesque trail.
name: Philosophenweg

excerpt: Views of Heidelberg & the Neckar River draw crowds to this scenic hill accessible via funicular.
detail_description: Königstuhl, standing at 568 meters, is the highest point in Heidelberg and offers a breathtaking view of the city and the Neckar valley. Accessible via a funicular or by climbing the Himmelsleiter (Ladder to Heaven), this scenic hill also features two special forest paths, Via naturae and the forest adventure trail, offering opportunities for learning and exploration for visitors of all ages.
name: Königstuhl

excerpt: Landmark amphitheater in a forested landscape, built by Nazis & later used by American forces.
detail_description: Thingstätte Heidelberg is a historic open-air amphitheater located on the Holy Mountain (Heiligenberg) in Heidelberg. Built in 1933-34 by the Nazi Party as part of their propaganda movement, it was one of 45 similar venues constructed across Germany. Today, it has been transformed into a public park while retaining its original architecture. Visitors can explore its history, enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding area, and take leisurely walks through the nearby forest.
name: Thingstätte Heidelberg

excerpt: Heidelberg is a town on the Neckar River in southwestern Germany. It’s known for venerable Heidelberg University, founded in the 14th century. Gothic Heiliggeistkirche church towers over the cafe-lined Marktplatz, a town square in the Altstadt (Old Town). The red-sandstone ruins of Heidelberg Castle, a noted example of Renaissance architecture, stand on Königstuhl hill.
detail_description: Heidelberg, a charming town in southwestern Germany, is home to the prestigious Heidelberg University and Gothic Heiliggeistkirche church. The red-sandstone ruins of Heidelberg Castle stand on Königstuhl hill, offering a glimpse of Renaissance architecture. Families can enjoy various leisure activities such as visiting playgrounds, swimming in numerous pools, exploring Heidelberg Zoo, or joining informative excursions led by woodland ecology experts through the Naturlich Heidelberg program.
name: Heidelberg

excerpt: Over 20,000 exhibits on 2000 years of medical science & pharmacy, including glass apothecary flasks.
detail_description: The German Pharmacy Museum, located within Heidelberg Castle, offers a captivating journey through the history of pharmacy and medicinal practices. With over 20,000 exhibits spanning 2,000 years, visitors can explore the evolution of medicine from ancient folk remedies to modern pharmaceutical science. The museum showcases antique pharmaceutical tools, laboratory equipment, medicinal herbs, books, and historical documents. It provides a unique glimpse into the development of healthcare and is a must-visit for those interested in the history of science and medicine.
name: German Pharmacy Museum

excerpt: Contemporary exhibits on 3 floors in art institution's HQ, founded 1869, with educational projects.
detail_description: The Kurpfälzisches Museum, located in the former Morass Mansion on Heidelberg's main pedestrian street, is a prominent art institution founded in 1869. The museum offers contemporary exhibits spread across three floors and encompasses a wide range of art and archaeology focusing on the Palatinate region of Germany.
name: Kurpfälzisches Museum

excerpt: 14th-century university, Germany's oldest, known for its science, arts, law & medical programs.
detail_description: Heidelberg University, established in the 14th century, is Germany's oldest and renowned for its programs in science, arts, law, and medicine. The university is located in a picturesque city with attractions like Hauptstrasse, Heiliggeistkirche church, and the old bridge over the Neckar River. The city also boasts Heidelberg Castle as one of its most famous landmarks. With 12 faculties and over 30,000 students, it's a popular destination for academic pursuits.
name: Heidelberg University

excerpt: Iconic pedestrian bridge constructed in 1788 offering scenic views of city landmarks.
detail_description: The Old Bridge Heidelberg, constructed in 1788, is an iconic pedestrian bridge that offers stunning views of the city's landmarks. It connects the Neckar River to Neuenheim Old Town and is made of classic red sandstone. The bridge leads to the romantic ruins of an old castle that once served as a heavily fortified Gothic stronghold and later as one of Germany's most magnificent residences. Unfortunately, much of the structure was destroyed during wars in the 17th century and never rebuilt.
name: Old Bridge Heidelberg

excerpt: Church offering tours & a tower climb that includes picturesque views of the city.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Heidelberg's vibrant Market Square, the Heiliggeistkirche, or Church of the Holy Spirit, stands as a magnificent testament to Gothic architecture. Dating back to its first mention in 1239 and later expanded by Elector Ruprecht III in 1398, this grand structure has served as both a place of worship and a communal hub for centuries.
name: Heiliggeistkirche

excerpt: Animal park with enclosures for global species including elephants, tigers, gorillas & sea lions.
detail_description: Heidelberg Zoo is a beloved animal park located on the picturesque banks of the Neckar River. It houses over 1,100 animals from more than 250 species, including elephants, tigers, gorillas, sea lions, red pandas, and brown bears. The zoo actively participates in conservation efforts through programs like WAPCA and EEP to raise awareness about endangered species.
name: Heidelberg Zoo

excerpt: University prison with cells covered with graffiti, used for unruly students from 1778 to 1914.
detail_description: Studentenkarzer, located at the Old University in Augustinergasse, is a historic university prison that was in use from 1778 to 1914. This private jail was used to discipline students for minor transgressions and fashionable stunts known as "Kavaliersdelikte." The cells are adorned with graffiti and paintings left behind by the detained students.
name: Studentenkarzer

detail_description: Kornmarkt is a charming square in Heidelberg that offers breathtaking views of the iconic castle, making it a must-visit spot on your walking tour. This delightful area has historical significance, having once served as a trading hub for corn and featuring the stunning Mariensaule statue at its center. Erected in 1718, this statue showcases the Madonna with her child and is surrounded by three beautiful basins.
name: Kornmarkt

excerpt: Striking 18th-century church with whitewashed interiors, chandeliers & an intricate altar painting.
detail_description: Jesuitenkirche is an 18th-century Baroque church located in the former Jesuit quarter of Heidelberg. Unlike most churches, it faces south instead of east. The interior features whitewashed walls and a striking 18th-century altar painting. Adorned with sculptures and intricate designs, the ornate facade reflects Baroque architecture. Throughout history, the church has served various purposes including as a military hospital and university library.
name: Jesuitenkirche

excerpt: The University's botanical gardens, containing huge greenhouses & 10,000 plant species. Free entry.
detail_description: Heidelberg Botanical Garden, situated on the grounds of Heidelberg University, is a serene oasis boasting a rich history dating back to 1593. This renowned attraction houses an impressive collection of over 10,000 plant species and features expansive greenhouses. While serving as a hub for research and conservation efforts, it also welcomes visitors to explore its diverse array of flora.
name: Heidelberg Botanical Garden

detail_description: Hauptstraße is a charming and lively street located in the heart of the city. It is known for its vibrant atmosphere, lined with a variety of shops, cafes, and restaurants. The street is perfect for leisurely strolls, offering plenty of opportunities for shopping and dining. With its unique blend of historical architecture and modern amenities, Hauptstraße captures the essence of the city's dynamic character.
name: Hauptstraße

detail_description: Alte Brücke, located in the heart of Heidelberg, is a popular spot for tourists. Despite its name, this old bridge is actually only 70 years old and was under repair during a recent visit. The view from the bridge is described as truly beautiful, especially at night when it offers a different perspective. Visitors recommend noting down the city address if traveling by car due to the complex layout of Heidelberg for first-time visitors.
name: Alte Brücke

detail_description: Little Old Town is a charming destination featuring a Baroque-style old town and the impressive Heidelberg Castle perched on a hill. This picturesque location has captivated visitors for years, making it a must-visit spot.
name: Little Old Town

excerpt: Lively Altstadt is the city’s historic heart, with cobblestone streets, centuries-old buildings, and bustling market squares overlooked by the hilltop Heidelberg Castle and gardens. Studentenkarzer is a graffiti-strewn former university prison, and the Deutsches Verpackungs-Museum displays product packaging and brand design. Main shopping street Hauptstrasse has bookstores, casual cafes, and traditional restaurants.
detail_description: Heidelberger Altstadt, also known as the Old Town, is the charming historic center of Heidelberg. Its cobblestone streets are lined with centuries-old buildings and lively market squares, overlooked by the impressive Heidelberg Castle and gardens perched on a hilltop. The area features unique attractions such as the Studentenkarzer, a former university prison covered in graffiti, and the Deutsches Verpackungs-Museum showcasing product packaging and brand design.
name: Heidelberger Altstadt

detail_description: Neckarwiese is the largest green area in central Heidelberg, situated along the right bank of the river at Neuenheim. It features expansive lawns and clusters of alders, lime trees, poplars, willows, and chestnut avenues. This picturesque spot holds historical significance as it was once an ancient ford of Heidelberg's Roman bridge that collapsed in the 3rd century.
name: Neckarwiese

detail_description: Marktplatz is the vibrant historic main market square located in Altstadt. It comes to life with its cobbled square hosting bustling markets every Wednesday and Saturday, as well as being a key venue for Heidelberg's annual Christmas Market. At the center stands the statue of Hercules, an iconic focal point dating back to the early 1700s.
name: Marktplatz

excerpt: Popular riverside park with open lawn areas & paths drawing sunbathers, picnickers & walkers.
detail_description: Neckarwiese is a popular riverside park located on the north bank of the Neckar River in Heidelberg, Germany. It is a favorite spot for locals, families, and students to enjoy outdoor activities during the summer. The park features open lawn areas, walking paths, and numerous playgrounds. Visitors can relax on the grassy stretches or take a leisurely stroll through the leafy trees and green spaces while enjoying views of the river.
name: Neckarwiese

excerpt: Exhibition of bodies preserved using plastination, a technique which exposes anatomical structures.
detail_description: The BODY WORLDS Museum in Heidelberg showcases real human specimens preserved using plastination, offering a fascinating exploration of the human anatomy. The exhibition delves into the secrets hidden beneath our skin and provides insights into how different parts of our anatomy contribute to feelings of happiness. Visitors can engage with over 150 interactive exhibits that delve into organ health and function, including the intriguing Anatomy of Happiness display.
name: Body Worlds Museum - Anatomy of happiness

excerpt: Museum charting the life & work of renowned German industrial chemist, Carl Bosch.
detail_description: CARL BOSCH MUSEUM HEIDELBERG gGmbH is a captivating museum dedicated to the life and work of the renowned German industrial chemist, Carl Bosch. The museum offers an intriguing insight into Bosch's life, set against the backdrop of history, and is housed in his own garage. Additionally, there is a sloping garden and cafeteria for visitors to enjoy.
name: CARL BOSCH MUSEUM HEIDELBERG gGmbH

detail_description: The Philosophers' Way, situated on a hill overlooking the Neckar River in Heidelberg, offers a picturesque and serene setting for leisurely walks and picnics. This winding path traverses through woodlands, vineyards, and gardens, providing stunning views of the city. Named after renowned philosophers who frequented it during the Romantic Era, this route leads to the university and features scenic viewpoints along the Schlangenweg.
name: Philosophers’ Way

excerpt: Traditional beer hall serving up draft beers alongside sausages, schnitzels & pretzels.
detail_description: Vetter's Alt Heidelberger Brauhaus is a traditional beer hall located in Heidelberg, offering a classic Teutonic atmosphere and serving up draft beers alongside authentic Bavarian fare such as sausages, schnitzels, and pretzels. The restaurant is known for its range of locally brewed ales and lagers, including the famous Vetter 33 ale, which holds the title of the world's strongest beer at 33% alcohol content.
name: Vetter's Alt Heidelberger Brauhaus

excerpt: Down-home, rustic restaurant whipping up a variety of schnitzels, sausages & draft beer.
detail_description: Weinstube Schnitzelbank is a cozy and rustic restaurant that used to be a cooper's workshop, now transformed into a candlelit pub. It's always bustling with people, so making dinner reservations is highly recommended. The menu offers regional specialties from Baden and the Pfalz, including schaufele, leberknodel, and saumagen.
name: Weinstube Schnitzelbank

excerpt: Relaxed vegetarian restaurant featuring health-conscious dishes, plus desserts & cooking classes.
detail_description: "Red die grüne Küche" is a relaxed vegetarian restaurant in Heidelberg that offers health-conscious dishes, desserts, and cooking classes. The Pfalzer couple behind the restaurant brings their idea and culinary skills to create a unique dining experience. The restaurant focuses on providing high-quality vegetarian and vegan delicacies made from organic ingredients. Guests can enjoy a diverse range of dishes at the buffet, including hot and cold options like crisp salads, spicy vegetables, and baked treats.
name: red die grüne Küche

detail_description: Heidelberg Hauptbahnhof, also known as the central station, is one of the two main train stations in Heidelberg, Germany. It serves as a key transportation hub with direct and connecting trains to major cities in Germany and Europe including Berlin, Munich, Cologne, Paris, Amsterdam, and Zurich. Additionally, it is a convergence point for buses and trams making it very convenient for visitors to navigate the city.
name: Heidelberg Hauptbahnhof

excerpt: This 439m-tall hill features the ruins of a Celtic fort, an 11th-century monastery & more.
detail_description: Heiligenberg is a 439-meter-tall hill located just north of Heidelberg's old town, offering stunning views and rich historical sites. The hill features the ruins of a Celtic fort and an 11th-century monastery, as well as the impressive Heidelberg Castle built on its terraced hillside. Visitors can embark on a culturally and historically significant tour with some challenging driving routes, starting from Heiligenberg down to the old town.
name: Heiligenberg

excerpt: Historic market square, home to the Gothic Church of the Holy Spirit, a 1700s fountain & many cafes.
detail_description: Heidelberger Marktplatz is a historic market square located in Altstadt, known for its Gothic Church of the Holy Spirit and a fountain dating back to the 1700s. This landmark has been significant since the Middle Ages, once serving as the site for public courts of justice and even executions. Heidelberg itself is famous for attractions like Heidelberg Castle and Heidelberg University, which is the oldest university in Germany.
name: Heidelberger Marktplatz

excerpt: Colossal, 18th-century wine vat in a castle basement with a viewing deck on top, plus wine tasting.
detail_description: The Barrel Building, located in Heidelberg Castle, is home to the famous Heidelberg Tun, an enormous wine cask with a capacity of 220,000 liters. Visitors can explore this colossal 18th-century vat and even enjoy wine tastings inside the castle. The building also features a viewing deck on top for stunning panoramic views of the surrounding area.
name: Barrel Building

excerpt: Lavish antiquities in vast, 17th-century palace featuring a rococo theater, plus ornamental gardens.
detail_description: Schwetzingen Palace, located just 15 minutes west of Heidelberg, is a vast 17th-century palace with ornamental gardens that have been preserved since their original design. The palace was the summer residence for a prominent family and reached its peak under Prince Elector Carl Theodor. It has a rococo theater and is known for its lavish antiquities.
name: Schwetzingen Palace

detail_description: Heidelberg University Library, located just a short distance from the main pedestrian street, is a magnificent Renaissance-style building completed in 1905. Its red sandstone facade adorned with sculpted figures and portraits reflects its historical significance as it houses around 3 million books. The library also features carved busts of renowned scholars on its staircase landings and hosts regularly changing exhibitions.
name: Heidelberg University Library

excerpt: Isolated ruins of a monastery offering a peaceful atmosphere & panoramic views from a tower.
detail_description: Michaelskloster Heiligenberg is a historic site located in southern Germany, with ruins dating back to the 5th century BC. The monastery was built in 1023 and offers panoramic views from its tower. The area is perfect for a peaceful hike, and visitors can explore the well-preserved ruins of the monastery. The site provides an opportunity to learn about the history of the monks who once lived there.
name: Michaelskloster Heiligenberg

excerpt: Mountaintop park with a popular educational flight show featuring many birds of prey.
detail_description: Tinnunculus Falknerei is a captivating mountaintop park that offers an unforgettable educational experience centered around birds of prey. Visitors can enjoy a stunning 45-minute flight display, known as Flugvorführungen, which takes place twice daily. It's advisable to plan your visit accordingly to ensure you don't miss this highlight.
name: Tinnunculus Falknerei

detail_description: The S-Printing Horse is a remarkable 13-meter high and 15-meter long sculpture, making it the largest horse sculpture globally. Situated at the forecourt of the Print Media Academy in Heidelberg, this iconic artwork has been a symbol of the city since its installation in 2000. While some may not consider it a must-see attraction, many find it intriguing and entertaining due to its impressive size and unique design.
name: S-Printing Horse

excerpt: Elegant museum featuring an array of art by inmates at psychiatric institutions from 1840 to 1945.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Germany, Sammlung Prinzhorn is a captivating museum that showcases an extraordinary collection of art created by individuals residing in psychiatric institutions from 1840 to 1945. This unique exhibition features around 20,000 pieces, including approximately 5,000 artworks originally curated by Hans Prinzhorn—a physician and art historian who recognized the profound creativity within mental illness.
name: Sammlung Prinzhorn

excerpt: Historical museum spotlighting the culture of Sinti & Roma people killed during the Nazi genocide.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Heidelberg's historic quarter, the Documentation and Cultural Center of German Sinti and Roma serves as a poignant reminder of the rich culture and tragic history of the Sinti and Roma people, particularly during the Nazi genocide. Housed in an 18th-century merchant building, this center not only offers a structured exhibition that is both informative and deeply moving but also fosters dialogue about cultural identity.
name: Documentation and Cultural Center of German Sinti and Roma

detail_description: Nestled just a short tram ride from the bustling Altstadt, Handschuhsheim is a charming neighborhood that once thrived as an independent village. Its rich history dates back to 765, and you'll notice the distinctive coat of arms featuring a glove with red lining throughout the area. Despite its name translating to 'glove home,' it’s not known for glovemaking but rather reflects the heritage of its original Franconian inhabitants.
name: Handschuhsheim, Tiefburg

detail_description: Hauptstraße is a must-visit destination in Heidelberg, Germany. As the longest pedestrian shopping street in the country, it offers a charming array of boutiques and shops where visitors can find unique souvenirs while immersing themselves in the lively local atmosphere. The Altstadt, or old city, is an essential stop with its vibrant restaurants, cafes, and ice cream bars that contribute to the area's bustling energy.
name: Hauptstraße

excerpt: Atmospheric, historic tavern with walls covered in old photos, serving robust German dishes & beer.
detail_description: Zum Seppl is a historic tavern and restaurant located in Heidelberg, Germany. It has a cozy atmosphere with walls adorned with old photos, creating a nostalgic ambiance. The establishment is known for serving hearty German dishes and an array of beer options. Dating back to the end of the 17th century, Zum Seppl is considered one of the oldest student bars in town and was once a well-frequented local brewery.
name: Zum Seppl

detail_description: Zum Roten Ochsen is a historic guest house located in Feudenheim, just a short drive from Mannheim's Old Town. The guest house features rustic-style accommodations and a restaurant that dates back to the 17th century. The restaurant is adorned with memorabilia-covered walls, some of which showcase the photos of famous past patrons like Mark Twain, Marilyn Monroe, and John Wayne.
name: Gasthaus "Zum Roten Ochsen"

detail_description: HANS IM GLÜCK - HEIDELBERG Westarkaden is a popular restaurant in Heidelberg known for its diverse selection of burgers, beers, wines, grilled specialties, and vegan/vegetarian dishes. The cozy atmosphere and creative menu make it a great place to enjoy delicious cocktails. Whether you're a meat lover, vegetarian, or vegan, there's something for every taste.
name: HANS IM GLÜCK - HEIDELBERG Westarkaden

detail_description: Weisse Flotte Heidelberg GmbH + Co. KG offers a variety of relaxing cruises along the Neckar River, providing visitors with an excellent way to explore the picturesque town of Heidelberg and its surroundings. From short 40-minute tours to longer three-hour excursions, there are options for everyone to enjoy stunning views of the castles in the Neckar valley, Mannheim harbor, or the Old Rhine at Worms.
name: Weiße Flotte Heidelberg GmbH + Co. KG

detail_description: Café Gundel is a must-visit spot in Heidelberg, Germany. It's located in one of the oldest bakeries and offers specialties like Heidelberger Pflastersteine and Kurfurstenkugeln - chocolate-covered marzipan balls filled with nougat cream and biscuit. The café provides a delightful experience for those looking to indulge in delicious treats while exploring the historic charm of Heidelberg.
name: Café Gundel

detail_description: Kornmarkt is a charming square in Heidelberg, featuring the stunning Corn Market Madonna statue, erected in 1718 as part of recatholisation efforts. The square also boasts the elegant Palais Prince Carl and the French Count de Graimberg's pale yellow house. It offers a picturesque view of Heidelberg Castle and is surrounded by ice-cream shops, cafes, and the town hall building.
name: Kornmarkt

detail_description: Destille is a popular bar in Heidelberg, known for its lively atmosphere and local drink specialties like Gehangter and Warmer Erpel. The bar is frequented by fitness enthusiasts and offers a vibrant setting where patrons often dance on tables. The floor is strewn with glass shards, prompting contemplation on whether the dancing or the broken glass came first. Visitors can enjoy quick service, great music, and the opportunity to meet new people.
name: Destille

detail_description: If you're in Heidelberg, don't miss the Chocolaterie St. Anna No.1, a charming shop located in Bismarckplatz. The staff is friendly and offers great advice on their drink selection. Their classic hot chocolate is a must-try; it's unique with a rich pool of chocolate topped with milk, and they even serve freshly made rose biscuits alongside it. This hidden gem also offers delicious ice cream and various flavors of coffee.
name: Chocolaterie St. Anna No.1

detail_description: Conditorei-Café Schafheutle is a well-known pastry shop and café located in the charming city of Heidelberg, Germany. Established in 1903, this family-owned business has been delighting customers with delicious cakes, pastries, and sweet treats for over a century. The café's interior exudes elegance and offers a cozy ambiance, making it an ideal setting for enjoying leisurely afternoon coffees or indulging in delectable desserts.
name: Café Schafheutle
